title: Drawing, "Design for a Brooch", 1979
signed: Signed in graphite, lower right: ROBERT EBENDORF / 1979
creditline: Museum purchase from Monet Jewelry Fund
description: Drawing of brooch design with seven illustrations; pointing arrows and notations. Upper left: SILVER SHEET about 22 ga.; Fragment of metal about 26 ga. / on the serface [sic] solder multicolor metals / then roll them into the serface [sic] after / soldering. The fragment is soldered to the silver sq. Frame / with care. Upper right: SILVER sheet / About 22-24 GA. / SCRIBE THE LINES / in metal; Bottom / sheet copper 22 ga / or 20 ga., Roll / the edge of each side; impressions left / from the rolling mill / will give bottom sheet / definition; center left illustration: sq. wire / solder to / the bottom of / silver sheet; to / raise the sheet / off the copper / bottom sheet; round tubing; Back side; silver / sheet sq. wire / round / tubing; Lower illustration: round / tubing; round tubing; to hold unit (A) top to unit (B) / Bottom sheet of copper you / FLAIR the tubing with / care. Lower right: round tubing; sq. wire; FLAIR with / CARE. Below, writing: 1. THE Bottom Sheet of copper is 20 or 22 ga. / Roll the 4 edges in the rolling mill to give / the serface [sic] edge a detail. / 2. The silver sq. frame is 22 ga., the serface [sic] / Grig lines are made with a metal scribe. / cut out center after the lines are put down on serface [sic]. 3. On the back side of the silver sq. frame solder / up 4 Rt. Angles in each corner. Make the Rt. Angles / From sq. wire / 4. In the corner of the two Rt. Angles solder round tubing. / the tubing will be flaired [sic] after going through the bottom sheet of copper. / The flaired [sic] tubing will hold the square silver frame in place on the copper sq. no soldering, held by pressure / 5. The Rt. Angles of sq. (4 of them, each corner) wire will allow the silver sheet to look as though it is floaging [sic; floating?]. / 6. The small thin metal fragment [sic] are made up out of many different metals. After they are soldered to / the Base metal they are run in the roller to mill them down to the same ga. of metal. When / they are oxidized they show many different colors. Solder the fragment to the silver sq. with CARE. Oxidizing / the metals are [sic] the very last thing you do. / 7. THE total size of brooch will be about 2” x 2” copper sq./siver [sic] sq. 1 ¼” x 1 ¼”/Fragment will vary in size. / ROBERT EBENDORF / 1979

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for a Brooch", 1979. Graphite on paper. Museum purchase from Monet Jewelry Fund. 1980-75-1.
